comment.body: On refresh page i see old good message "content.json download failed", i will check it later as Nekololi mentioned it can take some time, even i do not understand why, while comments on ZeroMe are so fast propagated.

@Pexo , it loaded :) It was slower because of large 4.5MB content.json
Seems to be largest ZN site about loli(lolicon?) painted images. I see it contains painted pornography and purpose seems to be mainly "erotic" so it seems to fit [PornographBlocklist](/13CgSQeywg2ius5pjXVCk7dKUCRkz5xvW3/).

> updates depend on you unless they change the Cloned From address
You have not explained why do you think so. You tried to "Upgrade" your clone and it replaced your sites.json/users.json file by one from the clonning original site? If that is so it is quite tricky, noob admin may have issue if he do not do backup and do Sign and publish..?

@Styromaniac: yes, this can be issue (if people clone outdated sites), maybe zeronet can ask or offer the user the link to the original site so user can compare features of both sites before clonning. Not sure what @nofish thinks and if the prompt popup support clickable links line breaks etc..

@Nekololi: According to documentation, the first phrase under "signs" is "User Bitcoin address". and [here](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/#signs) is also another detail about "signs", so it indeed seems to be signature: "ECDSA signature for the the content.json file content ... Signature generated on the dumped data, using Electrum Bitcoin message signature format". When i see problem i open dev. console (F12 key) and go to Console tab. Or try to open ZeroNet/debug.log and search (from bottom to the top) for the first like 4 or 5 letters of the site address where issue happened.

If i understood right the docs (i linked in your next post), then it is: "ECDSA signature for the the content.json file content ... Signature generated on the dumped data, using Electrum Bitcoin message signature format"
Do you have any source?

haha :D we watched same video but listen different things lol. I heard kind of information that it will be probably added once new python version is used by Zeronet, though he not said when he will use new python version :)
In [this post](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1226#issuecomment-371078750) he say that: "Yeah ZeroNet is single-threaded now, I planning to change it when moving to Python3."
@Pexo: be happy, zeronet works, is not blocked in our countries, multi threading is just a small feature

I am wondering where this encryption would be used by the kernel (which data encrypted) and in which cases so i can prevent my Lubuntu use it (in case it is added into LUbuntu stable kernel in future)
how do you backup it?

yes, good ideas, especialy this is what i agree:
- "If you want to delete a bigfile, you shouldn't have to ... go to ZeroHello do delete it in one fell swoop."
I am missing the option to quickly delete page (and its images) or particular image or video i do not like, instead of going to ZeroHello/FIles and hardly finding the file there. (ZeroHello/Files may have quick filtering field by sitename or file name)
@Styromaniac @Leftside or submitting zeroup issue here: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroUp/issues
How that could happen? How to prevent it?

Did you managed to fix it by opening ZeroTalk (0) menu and Rebuild database or quit ZN and delete data/users/zerotalk.db? Or it deleted your topics and propagated/signed the changes? I checked ZeroTalk several pages and can not find "by styro".

@Leftside: i am not far from the limit too, lets hope nofish raise it and more importantly, create [different mechanism](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/issues/123) so valid non spammer users do not need to rely on single person and being unable to change hub (without [loosing appearance of their old content](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/issues/121) ).

@Leftside: you mean you can not comment under my posts (i believe my profile is on [Sunhub](/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/), when you open sunhub (0) menu and find IDENTITY ADDRESS, do you see you have still some space left? If you have then this is strange. you do not see any error when you comment my post?

Here on ZeroMe to add asterisk, i think try to add \ before the asterisk:
\*

> I can't get the background image to load via css file
Are there any zite that is using css and images? Check it how they do it..

> I could convert the image to base64
You mean data uri? If not, try:
https://ezgif.com/image-to-datauri

@Styromaniac: 1MB image is excessive size for web page. If you wish, try to optimize that image i do it in Irfan View (Windows software), but there are also online tools https://duckduckgo.com/?q=online+optimize+image i think your target size should be like 150KB maximum, ideal below 50KB

I hope it is somewhere on the top of the @quantumkitty TODO list, she mentioned something like that it is needed to add NSFW category. I think it is declassing the site and make it less likely to be used and widely spoken about.

Even if the video site has NSFW category, some people will probably put NSFW content in general categories and admin is not always online. I still hope there will be some system for [community managed sites](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1086).

interesting alternatives, though i do not want to go thru the process of changing all internet accounts e-mail addresses, but maybe i should do it for the most important/sensitive services and for the rest only redirect all gmail to new tutanota, protonmail or similar mailbox. Though there are also good list of filters in my account and i would want all current mail be migrated to new provider.

[14:57:26] Site:1HeLLo..Tf3D 1UkrrSpnJmuiig6r5v88Kn3isaR64Fbh3 feed query Topics error: OperationalError: no such table: topic in NewsfeedPlugin.py line 159 > SiteStorage.py line 187

btw @all i think ZeroMe is made the way that i will see posts not only from hub on which i have profile and from hubs on which people i follow are not registered? Is there any mechanism or other ways i will get to the posts from other hubs?
**
Or i will see only posts from hubs my "Followed users" are members of? Issue is that when i follow someone member that is part of some unwanted hub, then i will start receiving unwanted posts and i will not be aware as a n00b member that i can prevent it unfollowing certain person and i will as an00b not know who?

i think i cant block all hub posts just because the hub has "Pedo" in its name. When an user creating profile, he can click this hub to create profile there out of curiosity maybe, and so i can not reliably tell all users in this hub posts should be hidden so i can not block it. I wish there is no possibility that regular ZN user will see the images from pedo hub without wanting to see that kind of content. I can imagine if i am a newcomer, it would hurt zeronet image in my eyes.
**
Btw, @Pexo if you are going to move your profile to your pedohub, it may help me or other users if you share a guide how you did it without loosing your old posts and images and keeping your username. [I was not successful](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1513334954_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6).

@Pexo: if that is so, it is Tor Browser devs fault, i think they should continue to support old technologies not breaking websites working. Why not notifying them via bug report? @Agentorange I am using latest FIrefox 63 and a few days back i uploaded Kopykate video without problem. Anyway Tor can be used even in classic Firefox, only it may be a bit less secure. Though i think one should [use VPN](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1519759218_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Which+VPN+proxy+setup+is+your+favorite) as the basic layer of anonymization and securing the data transfer, that way leaked IP will be VPN IP, not real IP.

+1
and that background image is really beautiful
ZH 377 Tor: error, port: closed
@29242719342 You mean which stuff? ZeroMe or ZeroHello? Or Zeronet (https://zeronet.io/docs/)

yes, porn is omnipresent. It is on many ZeroNet sites, that is why i created [bl0cklist](/13CgSQeywg2ius5pjXVCk7dKUCRkz5xvW3)

i like this one
It is good option. I think /Config page has much bigger potential allowing users to configure zeronet various ways. I would prefer if its design is more condensed, minimalistic.

what is that source tracker list? it is important to know because if almost no one uses it, i think such trackers will have low peer gain.

what it is about?

I think trackers do not stay long, especially IP ones, i think if you return after month, maybe 20-35% of them will no longer work. That is why [shared trackers](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:135:Changelog:+August+28,+2018) feature made by nofish is so nice. ZN care about trackers for us.

Note that if you mean shared tracker thanks to bootstrapper plugin as described under link i posted a few minutes ago, nofish says it is recommended to run it on nonstop running computer with fixed public IPv4 and open port. In my case i would not like to reveal my home IP as a tracker. For this purpose one can use VPS purchased [anonymously](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1517258702_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/What+is+the+good+setup+for+anonymous+secure+internet+usage).

it seems it has: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/search?q=upnp&type=Code
While i am using OpenVPN i think it can make difference in how upnp works? But this is what i see during ZN start:
grep -i upnp debug.log
INFO     ConnServer Trying to open port using UpnpPunch...
DEBUG    - Upnp request using "10.8.0.2" failed: No reply from IGD using 10.8.0.2 as IP
WARNING  ConnServer UpnpPunch run error: UpnpError: Failed to communicate with igd using port MyZNFileServerPort on local machine after 3 tries. in FileServer.py line 118 > UpnpPunch.py line 349 > UpnpPunch.py line 340
do you think authoritative regime countries can block your IP for the reason of helping connect people to see forbidden content?

i think your wording may be inaccurate, because everyone is using fileserver port. If its number is set to 0 in zeronet.conf (or in [/Config](/Config)) then ZN uses random port (if i remember right from 10000 to 40000). Important is i think if your network/router is set to do upnp so one has open port. Isnt that what you are talking about - open port?

@Styromaniac: i will try to change my wording and explain. In your first sentence, you are talking about file server port like there would be some other option. But i believe there is none as i think ZN always using file server port (as mentioned in my previous message).
it only depends if your firewall&router do not block the port and if your proxy (like a VPN, if applicable) forward the traffic so the port is open and not closed (appears on ZeroHello)
do you mind explaining why you think ZN does not always have file server port? ZN always have to listen at some port (file server port), else we can not get any new data?
You have not addressed my questions, instead writing parallel story.

You can try to find which log your package manager is using to log changes it is making. Create new help request at arch community forum, write packages upgraded during upgrade, find how to downgrade particular package that can influence the USB/network device. Restart computer, restart router. Do not forget to post your network configuration and also try to search "dmesg" syslog/messages log or whatever your system is using for system messages if it contains anything interesting seemingly related.

@Styromaniac: **can reproduce this**. I tried to upload file named "wombats..mp4" (the file was previously uploaded and played), but this time named like this not appeared in my /?Box , was not added to my profile folder (zeronet/data/kopykateaddr/data/users/me/), also not added to my content.json, but appeared on the /?Latest and in my data.json .. to remove it, i removed it from my data.json and then went to kopykate menu, marked it as my site and signed my content.json file there... maybe this is some double dot bug or something 👏
Screenshot would greatly help. And you failed to mention your revision number, operating system. I am on rev3750, Linux and optional files usage is shown correctly.
Maybe no one wants to download them. Your explanation is very vague. Please spend more time describing the issue so it can be reproduced.

Yes, i also do not see all videos in my video box on KopyKate site (like i no longer own them as you say). I have not yet dedicated my time playing with data.json and content.json in my profile in order to try to fix this (if that is possible to be fixed from my end, i am not a developer). 🙁

If the board is located on its own hub of the [Millchan Merger](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC) site, then the discussion board owner can delete the content of spammer thus it should not appear even in Recent posts section. Classic Millchan suffer from its one-site design where only one man can delete content, no board owners.

@Sirlotaplot: though in order for the board to appear on Millchan merger site you linked, i think you have to actualy link to your hub (the site you created during cloning). Once people visit your hub, it should become visible for them on the Millchan Merger site.. To draw attention to your hub, advertise its URL on sites like ZeroSites, New ZeroNet Sites, 0list

i think that the port status rather depend on firewall/router setup than the speed. if the internet is wired in your house, try to disconnect router and connect your device directly to the wire, that way you can tell if the router was the cause of a closed port. Else disabling firewall on your computer can tell more.

Advantage of a youtube.com is that you find everything under one search field, disadvantage of kopykate clones is that you find very little if the content is spread acros many sites. [Kxovid](/16KrKKRNHUc8WnRNuV9PgNqZQ8zqGteT4p) is good that it using universal merger sites that could be added to any kxovid cl0ne.

We can search the connected sites on zerohello, but kopkykate was not programmed to support newsfeed integration.

Language filtering can be good (also on other sites like zerome, actualy there is a pull request on the zerome github i think)
